message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.MM

This paper deals with the problem of estimating illuminant chromaticity from a single image, which is a common problem in computer vision and image processing. The paper proposes a new approach based on interreflections of light between diffuse surfaces, which is a topic that is closely related to computer graphics and rendering. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), which is the main category for research on image processing and computer vision. 

The paper also involves some mathematical modeling and optimization, which suggests that it could also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.GR (Computer Graphics), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper includes experimental results on a dataset of illumination and surface reflectance spectra, which suggests that it could also be relevant to cs.MM (Multimedia).
